title: 1999-A
statement: A. A+B Again?time limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputGiven a two-digit positive integer $$$n$$$, find the sum of its digits.InputThe first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\leq t \\leq 90$$$) — the number of test cases.The only line of each test case contains a single two-digit positive integer $$$n$$$ ($$$10 \\leq n \\leq 99$$$).OutputFor each test case, output a single integer — the sum of the digits of $$$n$$$.ExampleInput87721403419841099Output14 3 4 7 10 12 1 18

processed.result:
You are given a number of test cases. For each test case, you are given a two-digit positive integer.  Find the sum of the digits of each integer. 


For example:

* If the input is 87, the output is 15 (8 + 7 = 15) 
* If the input is 214, the output is 7 (2 + 1 + 4 = 7)
You are given a list of two-digit numbers. For each number, find the sum of its digits.
